channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.description:
Report E-2024010099

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Approximately 1 ounce of BPR 81156R NEUTRALIZER was released from a 330-gallon plastic tote due to a crack from Improper packing. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release.

item.title: Report X-2023121002
item.description:
Report X-2023121002

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-20
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained two metal paint cans and two metal jerrycans. All four were separated with fiberboard dividers, inside of plastic bags with positive closure rings and absorbent material in the bottom of the fiberboard box. the lid of one of the paint cans came open and spilled it's contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023120545
item.description:
Report X-2023120545

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-09
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Shipment was presented to the MEMH spill office as on odor. While investigating the shipment the spill agent noticed that wo of the four paint cans inside had spilled their contents. The cans were packaged in plastic bags with absorbent pads inside of a larger plastic bag. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023120803
item.description:
Report X-2023120803

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained four glass bottles inside packaged with an egg crate top and bottom. One of the glass bottles had a damaged cap causing the spill inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.
